{{Infobox military person |name= '''Sir William George Tennant''' |birth_date= {{birth date|1890|1|2}} |death_date= {{death date and age|1963|7|26|1890|1|2}} |birth_place= [[Upton-upon-Severn]], [[Worcestershire]], [[England]] |death_place= [[Worcester]], [[Worcestershire]], [[England]] |placeofburial= |placeofburial_label= Place of burial |image=[[Image:Tennant.jpeg|200px]] |caption= Captain William Tennant |nickname="Dunkirk Joe"[http://www.bbc.co.uk/herefordandworcester/features/2004/02/dunkirk.shtml BBC - Hereford and Worcestershire Features - William Tennant - hero of Dunkirk] |allegiance= {{UK}} |branch= [[Royal Navy]] |serviceyears=1905-1949 |rank=[[Admiral (Royal Navy)|Admiral]] |commands=[[HMS Repulse (1916)|HMS ''Repulse'']]
[[North America and West Indies Station|America and West Indies Station]] |unit=[[Force Z]] |battles=[[First World War]] *[[Battle of Jutland]] [[Second World War]] *[[Operation Dynamo]] *[[Last battle of the battleship Bismarck|Hunt for the ''Bismarck'']] *[[Sinking of Prince of Wales and Repulse|Sinking of ''Prince of Wales'' and ''Repulse'']] *[[Operation Overlord]] |awards=[[Knight Commander of the Order of the Bath]]
[[Commander of the Order of the British Empire]]
[[Member of the Royal Victorian Order]]
[[Legion of Merit]] (United States) |laterwork=[[Lord Lieutenant of Worcestershire]] }} [[Admiral (Royal Navy)|Admiral]] '''Sir William George "Bill" Tennant''' [[Knight Commander of the Order of the Bath|KCB]] [[Commander of the Order of the British Empire|CBE]] [[Member of the Royal Victorian Order|MVO]] [[Deputy Lieutenant|DL]] (2 January 1890 – 26 July 1963) was a [[United Kingdom|British]] naval officer. He was lauded for overseeing the successful [[evacuation of Dunkirk]] in 1940. Tennant subsequently served as captain of the battlecruiser [[HMS Repulse (1916)|HMS ''Repulse'']], when it searched for German capital ships in the Atlantic. He remained in this capacity when the ''Repulse'' was [[Sinking of Prince of Wales and Repulse|sunk by the Japanese]] along with [[HMS Prince of Wales (53)|HMS ''Prince of Wales'']] in the [[South China Sea]] on 10 December 1941, three days after the [[Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor]]. He later aided in the setup of the [[Mulberry harbour]]s and the [[Operation Pluto|Pluto pipelines]], a crucial part of the success of [[Operation Overlord]]. ==Biography== Born in [[Upton-upon-Severn]], Tennant joined the Royal Navy at age 15 in 1905,[http://www.kcl.ac.uk/lhcma/locreg/TENNANT.shtml Liddell Hart Centre for Military Archives] serving onboard [[HMS Britannia (1904)|HMS ''Britannia'']], eventually specializing in navigation in 1913. He later served in the [[First World War]] during the [[Gallipoli campaign]] and survived the sinking of his ship at the [[Battle of Jutland]] in 1916. After the war, Tennant joined the crew of [[HMS Renown (1916)|HMS ''Renown'']] and his future command, HMS ''Repulse'', during the future [[Edward VIII of the United Kingdom|King Edward VIII]]'s royal tours in the 1920s. By 1932, Tennant had achieved the rank of Captain. ==World War II== {{main|Dunkirk evacuation}} ===Dunkirk Evacuation=== On 26 May 1940, Captain Tennant was dispatched onboard the destroyer [[HMS Wolfhound (L56)|HMS ''Wolfhound'']] to [[Dunkirk]] to aid in the evacuation of more than 300,000 British and French troops left stranded when France fell to the Nazis. Tennant's task was to organize these dispirited men and get them onto the [[Little ships of Dunkirk|boats waiting to take them]]. Tennant stayed right up until the last boats left on 2 June, patrolling the beaches of Dunkirk with a megaphone searching for British troops. Tennant was lauded for his efforts at Dunkirk, and was appointed [[Companion of the Order of the Bath]] on 7 June 1940. The ordinary sailors under his command took to calling him "Dunkirk Joe". ===Captain of the ''Repulse''=== On 28 June Tennant became captain of the battlecruiser ''Repulse'', taking part in battles against the German battleships [[German battleship Scharnhorst|''Scharnhorst'']] and [[German battleship Gneisenau|''Gneisenau'']], and later in the hunt for the battleship [[German battleship Bismarck|''Bismarck'']].[http://www.uboat.net/allies/warships/ship/4065.html HMS Repulse (34) - Battlecruiser of the Renown class - Allied warships of WWII - uboat.net] ===Loss of the ''Repulse''=== {{main|Sinking of Prince of Wales and Repulse}} Tennant and ''Repulse'' joined Admiral Sir [[Tom Phillips (Royal Navy officer)|Tom Phillips]]' [[Force Z]], sent to Singapore to counter Japanese aggression in the Pacific, in December 1941. On 8 December, the day after the [[Attack on Pearl Harbor]], Singapore came under attack by Japanese air units, and Force Z departed for Malaya to attack a Japanese convoy, an operation that was cancelled shortly thereafter. Upon returning to Singapore, they received word of Japanese landings on Malaya, and Force Z - without air cover - made for Malaya to counter them. On 10 December the Japanese attacked Force Z. Tennant ably managed to avoid nineteen torpedoes dropped from Japanese aircraft, but ''Repulse'' eventually succumbed to a pincer attack, taking five torpedoes; she sunk within twenty minutes, taking a great deal of the crew with her. The survivors, including Captain Tennant, were rescued by [[HMAS Vampire (D68)|HMAS ''Vampire'']], one of the destroyers in Force Z.[http://www.forcez-survivors.org.uk/sinking2.html The Sinking of Prince of Wales and Repulse] ===Normandy=== In June 1944, Tennant - now an admiral - was placed in charge of the naval side of the transport, assembly and setup of the two [[Mulberry harbour]]s that provided port facilities for the coming [[invasion of Normandy]]. In August, he supervised the laying of the [[Operation Pluto|Pluto]] pipelines between France and England, which provided much needed fuel supplies for the ongoing conflict. For his efforts in the success of the Normandy invasion, Tennant was appointed [[Commander of the Order of the British Empire]] by [[George VI of the United Kingdom|King George VI]], and also received the United States [[Legion of Merit]]. ==Post-war service== Tennant was promoted to [[Knight Commander of the Order of the Bath]] in 1945 for his war service, and made commander of the [[North America and West Indies Station|America and West Indies Station]] after the war ended, and remained there until he retired in 1949 as a full admiral. In 1950, he was named [[Lord Lieutenant of Worcestershire]], serving until his death at the Worcester Royal Infirmary in 1963. ==In popular culture== In the TV series [[Dunkirk (TV series)|''Dunkirk'']], Captain Tennant is played by [[Adrian Rawlins]]. ==Honours== ===United Kingdom=== {|class="wikitable" |- ! Honour ! Abbreviation/Title !
